entries.title: Fox News Digital beats the competition as November's top news brand in multiplatform minutes, views
entries.description: Fox News Digital beat legacy media giants like CNN and The New York Times in multiplatform minutes and multiplatform views during the month of November.

entries.title: Fox News Poll:  Americans show little enthusiasm for a Biden-Trump rematch in 2024
entries.description: A recent Fox News Poll finds little enthusiasm and support for a rematch between President Joe Biden and former President Joe Biden in 2024.

entries.title: Trans advocate hit for claiming she's 'never heard' of anyone detransitioning: 'Madness'
entries.description: Conservatives were shocked when a prominent pro-transgender social worker claimed she has never heard of anyone detransitioning during a Congressional hearing.

entries.title: Fox News Poll: Bipartisan support for investigating Hunter Biden
entries.description: Hunter Biden has been involved in enough foreign business dealings over the years that public outcry now points toward DOJ investigation in this Fox News Poll.

entries.title: Idaho murders: White car spotted in footage obtained by police one day after killings
entries.description: Police obtained neighborhood surveillance footage that captured a white car near where four Idaho college students were murdered just one day after the killings

entries.title: New York bans the sale of dogs, cats and rabbits at retail pet stores
entries.description: New York Gov. Kathy Hochul signed into law legislation that aims to end the "puppy-mill-to-pet-store pipeline" — and prevent animal abuse from breeders.

entries.title: Warriors superstar Stephen Curry expected to miss ‘a few weeks’: report
entries.description: The Golden State Warriors will reportedly be without star point guard Stephen Curry for "a few weeks" after he suffered a shoulder injury Wednesday night.

entries.title: White House claims Biden has 'done the work' on border, despite historic migrant crisis
entries.description: The White House is defending the Biden administration's handling of the crisis at the southern border, ahead of the end of Title 42 -- and a potential surge -- next week.

entries.title: Texas waitress saves boy, takes impact of car that crashed into restaurant
entries.description: A car barreled through an Italian restaurant in Texas during the dinner rush, and the actions of a waitress helped save a boy from being struck.

entries.title: Noah Centineo recalls first acting roles and instant fame after 'To All The Boys I've Loved Before'
entries.description: Noah Centineo saw massive success after starring in "To All the Boys I've Loved Before" and the two additional movies in the franchise. As a young actor, he struggled to book roles.

entries.title: Patriots' Bill Belichick shows love to Cardinals' DeAndre Hopkins in mic'd up moment
entries.description: New England Patriots head coach Bill Belichick made sure to show his love and respect for Arizona Cardinals wide receiver DeAndre Hopkins before their game this past Monday.

entries.title: Rob Gronkowski jokes Tom Brady could play until he's 68, touts QB's broadcasting chops
entries.description: Rob Gronkowski was met by paparazzi and autograph seekers after leaving a West Hollywood eatery. He talked to the camera about Tom Brady.

entries.title: California school district president resigns after allegedly hosting students at party with 'dirty Santa'
entries.description: California school district president Steven Llanusa resigned after he invited choir students to perform at an adult party, where they were allegedly exposed to a "dirty Santa."

entries.title: Adam Silver would be ‘hugely disappointed’ if first female NBA head coach isn’t hired within five years
entries.description: NBA commissioner Adam Silver said he would be "hugely disappointed" if the league does not have its first female head coach within the next five years.

entries.title: Kelsea Ballerini defends her divorce: ‘Judge me for it, fine, that's on you'
entries.description: Kelsea Ballerini defended her decision to get a divorce from ex-husband Morgan Evans. She also opened up about the "shame" surrounding divorce in a new podcast interview.

entries.title: Dolphins' Tua Tagovailoa on dealing with Buffalo's expected cold weather: 'It snows in Alabama'
entries.description: Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa knows the conditions in Buffalo this weekend when he takes on the Bills will be cold. But he says the snow won't bother him.

entries.title: Youngkin: Loudoun County dad arrested while objecting to alleged assault deserves 'universal apology'
entries.description: Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin, a Republican and former businessman from Falls Church, sounded off on 'The Story' following Scott Ziegler's indictment.

entries.title: Former 'SNL' star Chris Redd claims attack on him outside NYC comedy club was a 'planned situation'
entries.description: Chris Redd emphasized that the attack on him outside of a NYC comedy club was a "planned situation," in a new interview. The comedian was attacked on Oct. 26 outside the Comedy Cellar.

entries.title: Lions' Dan Campbell praises Mike White's toughness ahead Jets' matchup: 'I got a lot of respect for him'
entries.description: Detroit Lions head coach Dan Campbell praised Mike White's toughness during a press conference on Wednesday, saying he has "a lot of respect watching him" play.

entries.title: Rams' Bobby Wagner touts Baker Mayfield's epic performance: 'There needs to be a lot of credit to him'
entries.description: Quarterback Baker Mayfield's comeback victory for the Los Angeles Rams over the Las Vegas Raiders stunned even his veteran teammate, linebacker Bobby Wagner.

entries.title: Biden's Commerce Dept. silent on whether Hunter Biden’s former business partner will remain on advisory board
entries.description: The Department of Commerce is staying mum on whether it will take any action to remove from a presidential advisory council a business executive who previously worked with Hunter Biden.

entries.title: Fox News crushes CNN, MSNBC in 2022, finishes No. 1 among all of cable for 7th straight year
entries.description: Fox News will finish 2022 as the most-watched cable network for the seventh straight year, and “The Five” made history as the first non-primetime show to top cable news.

entries.title: Idaho murders: Police running down list of 22K Hyundais, seek 'anything abnormal' in frat party timeline
entries.description: Idaho police revealed new details about the Hyundai Elantra they are seeking in connection with the quadruple stabbing of four students in an off-campus rental.

entries.title: Ex-NFL star Aqib Talib, brother, youth sports league face wrongful death lawsuit from family of late coach
entries.description: The family of a late youth sports football coach filed a wrongful death lawsuit on Tuesday against Aqib Talib, his brother and the league

entries.title: Mike Leach's former college QB remembers late head coach: 'Always made me believe I was something special'
entries.description: Gardner Minshew transferred to Washington State and, with the help of Mike Leach, put together an outstanding senior season that helped him get drafted.

entries.title: Florida deputy dresses as Grinch, gives onions to school zone speeders
entries.description: Col. Lou Caputo of Marathon, Florida, has a unique way of getting motorists to slow down in a school zone: He hands out onions to offenders while dressed as the Grinch.

entries.title: Scott Peterson case: New trial decision looms as families mark 20 years since murder
entries.description: Scott Peterson and his attorneys are awaiting a judge’s decision over whether he will be granted a new trial in connection with the murders of his wife, Laci, and unborn son.

entries.title: North Carolina mall shooting: 2 shot, 1 suspect arrested
entries.description: A mall shooing in North Carolina at the Northlake Mall in Charlotte injured two people Thursday, and one suspect has been taken into police custody.

entries.title: Sweet! It's National Cupcake Day — here are yummy facts
entries.description: National Cupcake Day is December 15. Here are fun facts about the history of cupcakes, the evolution of cupcakes and popular cupcake flavors. There are even ATMs that will dispense cupcakes.

entries.title: European Parliament president says corruption broke trust that took years to build
entries.description: Roberta Metsola, president of the European Parliament, apologized Thursday for the series of arrests made on members of the legislative body over corruption charges.

entries.title: Lake Mead rangers aim to identify man who was 'violently assaulted' while camping with family
entries.description: The National Park Service Investigative Services Branch and Lake Mead Recreation Area Park Rangers are asking for any information regarding a Nevada assault victim.

entries.title: Iran has sentenced 400 protesters to prison sentences up to 10 years: Report
entries.description: Courts in and around the Iranian capital of Tehran have reportedly sentenced 400 demonstrators to prison sentences of up to 10 years as the regime seeks to crack down.

entries.title: Kentucky Supreme Court strikes down school choice measure, drawing strong reactions from both sides
entries.description: The Kentucky Supreme Court said a controversial state law that granted tax credits for donations supporting private school tuition was unconstitutional.

entries.title: Children’s museum in Virginia hosts ‘Pride night with Legendary Santa,’ drag queen plays the Snow Queen
entries.description: The Children's Museum of Richmond "invited LGBTQIA+ families to enjoy visits with Santa" for its "Pride Night with Legendary Santa" featuring a drag "snow queen."

entries.title: El Paso hit by 255% increase in migrant encounters as Title 42's end nears, migrants start fires to keep warm
entries.description: The El Paso Sector of the southern border has seen a massive 255% increase in migrant encounters since Oct. 1, as the end of Title 42 is just days away.

entries.title: Texas child found dead in washing machine was visited by CPS investigators twice before his death: report
entries.description: A new report shows that a 7-year-old found dead in a washing machine suffered a traumatic childhood and was not removed from his home despite multiple abuse investigations.

entries.title: Philadelphia public school students, staff must wear masks for 10 days after returning from winter break
entries.description: Philadelphia public school students and staff will need to wear masks for 10 days after coming back from the winter break, officials said.

entries.title: Biden's poll numbers rebound slightly, but majority of young voters want new representation: poll
entries.description: A new CNN poll found that President Joe Biden's 2024 support among voters has increased over the past few months but remains low.

entries.title: IPhone emergency service helps rescue pair after crash in southern California forest
entries.description: Two people stranded following a car crash in a remote California canyon were rescued by law enforcement agencies after using an iPhone 14 emergency service.

entries.title: Biden administration boating proposal would be 'greatest regulatory overreach' of its kind, critics warn
entries.description: A proposed Commerce Department rule that would restrict speed to 10 knots or 11.5 miles per hour for all boats over 35 feet is being called over-restrictive.

entries.title: Biden roasted for sending South Africa $8 billion to shut down coal plants: ‘Weapon grade lunacy’
entries.description: Commentators across Twitter slammed President Joe Biden after he announced billions in foreign aid would be sent to South Africa to change their energy infrastructure.

entries.title: Florida attorney general distributing free Child ID kits to parents of kindergartners throughout state
entries.description: Florida Attorney General Ashley Moody announced every parent or guardian of a kindergartner in the state will receive a free Child ID kit through a joint safety initiative.

entries.title: Questions surround fired non-binary Biden official's alleged thefts: 'How did he keep his security clearance?'
entries.description: 'The Five' co-hosts discuss the arrest of former Department of Energy official Sam Brinton and what the Biden administration's vetting process entails.

entries.title: Let’s set the record straight on our credit card act. It is designed to rein in $77 billion in fees we all pay
entries.description: Let’s set the record straight on our bipartisan credit card act. It is designed to help struggling consumers rein in $77 billion in fees that we all help pay.

entries.title: Virginia woman arrested after 20-month-old son dies from fentanyl overdose
entries.description: The Prince William County Police Department arrested a Virginia woman who was wanted in the death of her 20-month-old son who died in June of a lethal dose of fentanyl.

entries.title: Florida man caught on camera shooting his way into vape shops before burglarizing them
entries.description: Sarasota County Sheriff's Office is looking for a burglar caught on camera breaking into vape shops by shooting the glass front doors until they shatter.

entries.title: Reverse Midas touch: Why the indicted Crypto King makes everyone look awful
entries.description: With the defunct cryptocurrency FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried's arrest, many are looking closer at those who championed the cause and accepted payments.

entries.title: 'Weapon of choice': Americans on alert as tech-savvy criminals use tracking device to stalk, steal
entries.description: Apple AirTags are coming under increased scrutiny after people across the country have said they facilitated as car theft or stalking, leading to Apple facing a class-action suit.

entries.title: Peter Boghossian teaches 'forbidden classes' as 'truth-seeking' University of Austin raises $100 million
entries.description: Peter Boghossian provided insight into the University of Austin's first year, telling Fox News that the nascent institution raised more than $100 million from donors.

entries.title: Maine mom raises the alarm after her baby daughter nearly dies from swallowing a water bead
entries.description: A Maine mom is speaking out after her infant daughter nearly died when she accidentally swallowed a water bead, a toy marketed for sensory play. Others sound the alarm as well.

entries.title: Kat Von D on putting down roots in Indiana and traditional routine that inspired latest project
entries.description: Hollywood tattoo star, Kat Von D, is leaving Los Angeles to pursue family life in Indiana with her son and husband after publishing first children's book.

entries.title: Comedians defend the 'absurdity' of edgy, beloved classics like 'Blazing Saddles,' 'Airplane!' and more
entries.description: Movie critics and comedians defend the humor in old, beloved films now considered controversial and could likely never be made in today's cancel culture climate.

entries.title: Republicans plan probe into Hunter Biden’s Chinese business deals: ‘Accountability is coming’
entries.description: Republicans on the House Committee on Oversight and Reform, who will retake the majority next month, told Fox News Digital “accountability is coming” for the Biden family.

entries.title: Sam Brinton helped craft model school policy keeping parents in dark about kids' gender change
entries.description: Fired nuclear official Sam Brinton helped craft a model policy on suicide prevention that tells school districts to keep "unaffirming" parents in the dark about a child’s LGBTQ identity.

entries.title: My Christian group was denied service at a restaurant. But we didn’t weaponize government over this offense
entries.description: My Christian group was denied service at a restaurant. But we didn’t weaponize government over this offense. Those who shout ‘tolerance’ could learn from it.

entries.title: New Jersey men lost in the Atlantic Ocean for 10 days on Atrevida II recount their experience: 'Small miracle'
entries.description: Two men who were missing for 10 days after their vessel, the Atrevida II, was pushed out to sea by a storm and lost power recalled their miraculous rescue.

entries.title: GREG GUTFELD: Biden has had it with everyone discussing his advanced age
entries.description: Fox News host Greg Gutfeld weighs in on reports President Biden "has had it" with the media's coverage on his age after the President reportedly "vented to allies."

entries.title: Wisconsin man denied insurance coverage for life-saving device after heart attack: 'Not medically necessary'
entries.description: Wisconsin man Dan Saccomando was prescribed a wearable defibrillator after a heart attack, but his insurance provider denied coverage.

entries.title: On this day in history, Dec. 15, 1791, Bill of Rights ratified, codifying unique freedoms in new nation
entries.description: The Bill of Rights, containing the first 10 amendments to the U.S. Constitution, were ratified on this day in history, Dec. 15, 1791 — enumerating rights and protections cherished by Americans.

entries.title: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi official portrait unveiled during ceremony on Capitol Hill
entries.description: A portrait was unveiled for House Speaker Nancy Pelosi at the Capitol Building Wednesday, which will be placed into the Speaker's Lobby alongside other previous Speaker portraits.

entries.title: LAURA INGRAHAM: Biden admin is abusing its power by letting illegal immigrants overrun America
entries.description: Laura Ingraham lambasts the Biden administration for not addressing the flood of illegal immigrants coming across the border, jeopardizing the safety of Americans on "The Ingraham Angle."

entries.title: TUCKER CARLSON: What can we learn from what's happening in California?
entries.description: Fox News host Tucker Carlson shares his take on reparations programs being proposed in California and across the rest of the nation on "Tucker Carlson Tonight."

entries.title: Falcons QB Marcus Mariota to undergo knee surgery after his abrupt departure from the team
entries.description: Marcus Mariota is scheduled to have surgery on his knee, which will put the Atlanta Falcons quarterback on injured reserve, head coach Arthur Smith said.

entries.title: Henry Cavill confirms Superman exit: 'It's been a fun ride with you all'
entries.description: Henry Cavill and DC Studios chief James Gunn announced Wednesday the actor will not reprise his role in the next Superman project, which will focus on the superhero's early life.

entries.title: Stephen 'tWitch' Boss remembered by 'SYTYCD' judge Mary Murphy after his death at 40: 'Everybody loved him'
entries.description: Mary Murphy honored her fellow "So You Think You Can Dance" judge Stephen "tWitch" Boss after his death by suicide at the age of 40 on Tuesday.

entries.title: Biden administration considers extending asylum option to Cuba, Nicaragua and Haiti: Report
entries.description: The Biden administration is considering plans to extend an asylum program that applies to Venezuela to Cuba, Nicaragua and Haiti as well.

entries.title: SEAN HANNITY: The evidence is undeniable, the border is now wide open
entries.description: Fox News host Sean Hannity covers the deadly consequences of President Biden's border policies as the media finally is covering the crisis.

entries.title: Joakim Noah crashes Tom Thibodeau's Knicks presser with hilarious question
entries.description: Being back in Chicago, Knicks head coach Tom Thibodeau was bound to see familiar faces. But when Joakim Noah walked into the room, he couldn't help but rip him for being late.

entries.title: Congress averts partial government shutdown with short-term funding bill
entries.description: Congressional lawmakers approved a short-term funding bill in a 224-201 vote, allowing an additional week to work on on a $1.7 trillion spending bill.

entries.title: For Lionel Messi, France is the perfect challenge as he chases immortality
entries.description: The last box to check on Lionel Messi's list of soccer accomplishments is a World Cup title. On Sunday, there's no more fitting opponent he and Argentina could face than France.

entries.title: Wisconsin police shooting injures one officer, female shooter killed, police say
entries.description: A Wisconsin officer was shot and a female shooter was killed during a gunfire exchange inside a home, police said.

entries.title: DeSantis urging COVID investigation puts Fauci on defensive: 'What's the problem with vaccines?'
entries.description: On CNN Wednesday, Dr. Anthony Fauci reacted to Gov. Ron DeSantis’, R-Fla., request that the Florida Supreme Court probe the COVID vaccines.

entries.title: New York police search for knife-wielding man who took chicken nuggets, hamburgers from McDonald's
entries.description: New York City police are asking the public for help to identify a man who they say took chicken nuggets and hamburgers in a McDonald's robbery on Dec. 5.

entries.title: Cowboys' owner Jerry Jones on Odell Beckham Jr. decision: 'Stand by'
entries.description: Jerry Jones' interest in Odell Beckham Jr. has apparently not waned, and the Cowboys owner said a decision on adding the wide receiver has to be made "sooner rather than later."

entries.title: JESSE WATTERS: Democrats blow billions on the homeless and the problem doesn't go away
entries.description: Jesse Watters evaluates Democrats' handling of homelessness and calls out Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass for giving herself "unrestricted power" on "Jesse Watters Primetime."

entries.title: Mississippi police officers killed responding to welfare check at motel, female shooter also died, cops say
entries.description: Two Mississippi police officers were shot and killed Wednesday by a woman in a parked car, authorities said.

entries.title: Cardinals GM Steve Keim takes leave of absence amid disappointing season
entries.description: Arizona Cardinals GM Steve Keim is reportedly taking a "health-related," indefinite leave of absence amid a disappointing season at 4-9.

entries.title: Rapper Gunna enters plea in Atlanta racketeering case
entries.description: Rapper Gunna was arrested earlier this year along with fellow rapper Young Thug and more than two dozen other people. He must complete 500 hours of community service.

entries.title: Beneficiaries of 'dirtbag' Sam Bankman-Fried's 'fraudulent,' 'dirty' money should give it back, Pirro says
entries.description: FTX cryptocurrency exchange founder Samuel Bankman-Fried has been under fire since being arrested and imprisoned Nassau, New Providence, The Bahamas.

entries.title: Florida police arrest five men and one juvenile on multiple child porn-related charges
entries.description: Florida police arrested five men and one 16-year-old for allegedly possessing multiple child pornography-related files on their electronic devices.

entries.title: ‘The White Lotus’ star Jennifer Coolidge shares behind-the-scenes cast photo to celebrate Golden Globe noms
entries.description: Jennifer Coolidge posted a photo with her "The White Lotus" cast to celebrate the show's Golden Globe nominations, which were announced on Monday.

entries.title: Mississippi death row inmate dines on pork chops, biscuits in last meal before execution
entries.description: A Mississippi death row inmate ate all the food he requested for this last meal Wednesday, corrections officials said.

entries.title: World Cup Daily: France's super sub, Morocco's amazing almost-goal and more
entries.description: France and Kylian Mbappé ended Morocco's historic run and is headed back to the World Cup final for a highly anticipated matchup with Lionel Messi and Argentina.

entries.title: Idaho murders: JonBenét's half-brother gives Moscow police 'tremendous credit' for asking for help
entries.description: JonBenét Ramsey lauded local cops for quickly enlisting outside agencies in their probe of four University of Idaho students found stabbed to death last month in a home near campus.

entries.title: Michigan sheriff says man with filed-down teeth kidnapped and sexually assaulted woman for 3 weeks
entries.description: A 36-year-old Michigan man has been arrested after police say he kidnapped and repeatedly raped a woman, threatening to "rip out her throat."

entries.title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy slams idea of Russian athletes returning to Olympics: 'Their flags are stained in blood'
entries.description: Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy spoke out against the International Olympic Committee's recent decision to explore options that would allow Russian and Belarusian athletes to compete.

entries.title: Pelosi hammer attack: California judge rules enough evidence against David DePape for trial
entries.description: David DePape, the man accused of attacking Paul Pelosi in October, will go to trial after a judge ruled sufficient evidence was presented in court.

entries.title: Dodgers add Noah Syndergaard to rotation on one-year deal: report
entries.description: Former Mets, Angels and Phillies right-hander Noah Syndergaard has been added to the Los Angeles Dodgers' rotation after he agreed to a one-year deal to return west.

entries.title: COVID origins 'may have been tied' to China's bioweapons program: GOP report
entries.description: Republican House intelligence committee members allege in a report that there are indications that COVID-19 could be tied to China’s biological weapons research program.
